item.title: Free Mullet MadJack Update Features ULTRAKILL
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/free-mullet-madjack-update-features-ultrakill

The high-octane, fast-and-loud shooter Mullet MadJack launched to wide acclaim from critics, and with a new crossover update featuring New Blood Interactive's ULTRAKILL, there's even more to rave about.

The bulk of new content comes in the form of Boss Rush Mode. Fight against the clock and slay Mullet MadJack's various bosses and compete with global rankings for the highest score. Make it to the final boss of the Mode and you'll be met with a surprise: a character from ULTRAKILL.

V2 from ULTRAKILL makes an appearance and you'll have to fight head-to-head against this extremely lethal machine. Fans of ULTRAKILL will recognize this as a punishing boss encounter, and the crossover makes for an exciting addition to Mullet MadJack.

Mullet MadJack is a roguelite first-person shooter featuring fast gameplay. Players have only a handful of seconds to make it to the next floor. Recover precious time by slaying robobillionaires and save the love of your life. With a story-based Campaign mode as well as an endless Survival mode, Boss Rush will make a fine addition to the critically-acclaimed title.

ULTRAKILL is an equally fast-paced shooter, with a brutal difficulty curve and plenty of style. Take control of a killer robot called V1 and literally bathe in the blood of your enemies to regain health. It's currently in Early Access and, while the official launch of ULTRAKILL is still up in the air, it's received quite a bit of buzz from fans with over 100,000 Steam reviews.

Whether you're a fan of Mullet MadJack or ULTRAKILL, fans won't have to wait long for this crossover. The update -- featuring Boss Rush Mode and Punished V2 as its final encounter -- is available for download today on PC.

For now, this crossover is exclusive only to Mullet MadJack, but who knows? Maybe we'll see something in ULTRAKILL in the future.

Austin cut his teeth writing various  fan-fiction stories on the RuneScape forums when he was in elementary school. Later on, he developed a deep love forâ€¦ More about Austin
